text: Kenneth Copeland Airport is a public airport located eighteen miles (29 km) northwest of the central business district (CBD) of Fort Worth, in Tarrant County, Texas, United States. The airport is used solely for general aviation purposes, mainly those of the airport's eponym, televangelist Kenneth Copeland (whose ministry is located near the airport). The airport was formerly known as Marine Corps Air Station Eagle Mountain Lake, until it was purchased by Kenneth Copeland Ministries in the 1980s. == Facilities == Kenneth Copeland Airport has two runways: * Runway 17/35: 6,000 x 125 ft. (1,829 x 38 m), Surface: Concrete * Runway 12/30: 3,000 x 125 ft. (914 x 38 m), Surface: Asphalt == External links == == References == Category:Airports in Fort Worth, Texas Category:Airports in Tarrant County, Texas
title: Kenneth Copeland Airport
